intro: Symplocos boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian wax myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Symplocos boliviana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters.
